comments:
I have created a brand new workspace, import projects from old 3.2 workspace by import action.
Everythink work well. After restart i was unable to open any file by any editor.
It hangs up. 

This is my deadlock report:

"main" prio=1 tid=0x080c0e90 nid=0x15dc runnable [0xbf827000..0xbf828ac8]
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._gtk_enumerate_printers(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.gtk_enumerate_printers(OS.java:6251)
        at org.eclipse.swt.printing.Printer.getPrinterList(Printer.java:77)
        at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.isPrintable(TextViewer.java:4135)
        at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.canDoOperation(TextViewer.java:3672)
        ...
i am using openSUSE 10.2 with default KDE 3.5.5 "release 45.4" (qt3-3.3.7-14) and default GTK(gtk2-2.10.6-24.2), i am using default cups (cups-1.2.7-12.1), hp printer is on remote server computer, which is actually offline ( i am using notebook at home).

"VM Periodic Task Thread" prio=1 tid=0xb1607678 nid=0x15e4 waiting on condition
BTW: After successful connection into VPN (where is hp printer online) eclipse wake up!

I've had the same issue on Kubuntu (Feisty), with no printers setup.  It appears that changing my printing system from "Generic UNIX LPD Print System" to "CUPS (Common UNIX Print System)" made it so that editors open now.
Is this bug the same as https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=195225 ?

This is a duplicate of 153936. I've added a jar that has some additional checks and a disable printers system property. Can you give it a try on your system and let me know if it works for you? (Post response in 153936 as I am marking this bug as a DUPLICATE).



*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 153936 ***
